title: Family and Consumer Sciences Service Area: Middle School (5-8)
subject: CTE

document.title: Iowa Career and Technical Education Middle School Standards

54F213AC1DD64B3F861AE600A6C829AB.description:
Demonstrate basic skills for production, alteration, repair and recycling of
textiles, fashion and apparel.

CE5D8EA603B148DBB55D399693D54E55.description:
Analyze current technology, trends and innovations that facilitate design
and production of textiles, fashion and apparel.

EA92571C418E4126B4075A2E4DF4D297.description:
Demonstrate skills needed to produce, alter or repair textiles, fashion
and apparel.

473EA241C4614B84B91CF5D77D3A222D.description:
Analyze foodborne illness factors, including causes, potentially
hazardous foods and methods of prevention.

23B1E98781C845C69894D2BDA02A3E8B.description: Analyze conditions and practices that promote safe food handling.

6EF11F542F2B40AEA6ABDDE454543B06.description:
Evaluate factors that affect food safety from production through
consumption.

D9434A7EA4804615B26B0D3FA2F0B4CE.description:
Demonstrate ability to select, store, prepare and serve nutritious,
aesthetically pleasing food and food products.

1B5C33AA0C904C0EB59192CE4A1FCD41.description:
Apply current dietary guidelines in planning to meet nutrition and
wellness needs.

BACE45871BA3460EAC996050525C47DE.description:
Demonstrate ability to acquire, handle and use foods to meet nutrition
and wellness needs of individuals and families across the life span.

5251DBAFFBDA4F74A061C526D799210A.description:
Analyze sources of food and nutrition information, including food labels,
related to health and wellness.

73EDF722E38B4B5B93794C76DD4E1D7D.description:
Analyze the effects of food and diet fads, food addictions and eating
disorders on wellness.

4E17A0721177449AB26E6DCA33B8FAF0.description: Evaluate the effect of nutrition on health, wellness and performance.

7BD5ADE73A2249569DBDCB6892AFB865.description:
Examine the nutritional needs of individuals and families in relation to
health and wellness across the life span.

D32D3B5E432442E0BAEDE72EA5B44B1C.description:
Demonstrate nutrition and wellness practices that enhance individual
and family well-being.

71E0C0122CA044E98D0F7FE54F935FA7.description: Analyze the effects of self-esteem and self-image on relationships.

AD1D104A365341DB91EC1194E22C0689.description: Analyze the effects of personal characteristics on relationships.

C48D3C06332C4A17B2CD1B6C3514A430.description:
Analyze personal needs and characteristics and their effects on
interpersonal relationships.

B66FD3402B1B403AB55302FF3CBE607B.description:
Demonstrate stress management strategies for family, work and
community settings.

80F9BC099D884ECEA2C7455591614A64.description: Analyze factors that contribute to healthy and unhealthy relationships.

92743902F033449E88A254C8E2DCFB32.description:
Analyze processes for building and maintaining interpersonal
relationships.

E89224D18CE64B02979631D9C4A17C29.description: Analyze functions and expectations of various types of relationships.

1DBCF22BD4344AD2914857A79A5EF151.description:
Demonstrate respectful and caring relationships in the family, workplace
and community.

C57AA0E8FB1D45E28BE7C5D6F02A20C9.description: Analyze the role of communication on human growth and development.

A432DCED0BA94891A95FEE1646551C83.description: Analyze the role of nurturance on human growth and development.

C0ADF41744BB47C990C8ABD5DC8AFA92.description:
Analyze strategies that promote growth and development across the life
span.

DA73D9A419D746DEABAFF38C7A59433E.description:
Analyze the influences of life events on individuals' physical, emotional,
social, moral and cognitive development.

CB9B508EB37C4E04BD2667DDE312E88E.description:
Analyze the influences of social, economic and technological forces on
individual growth and development.

C71ADB2DBE9E4E9F90E32324CDB4F54E.description:
Analyze the influences of heredity and environment on human growth
and development.

322519C7A30D427D91BF9623B08B84C9.description: Analyze conditions that influence human growth and development.

687A863B868E4DDFA8E54DD24E72DFFE.description:
Analyze interrelationships among physical, emotional, social, moral and
cognitive aspects of human growth and development.

F2D75391DA7A4508974BD04BC0F4904D.description: Analyze physical, emotional, social, moral and cognitive development.

F99C7C02DCD1425F89D5349A1AF89C9E.description:
Analyze principles of human growth and development across the life
span.

756BAA5970034DF588261FDF59E35524.description: Analyze factors that influence human growth and development.

70B0D64F17494A52BC7DD68FC3BC6F90.description:
Analyze the psychological impact that the principles and elements of
design have on the individual.

88F4DAFE7FA74E6A9782EB0B3E1C5F6F.description:
Evaluate the use of elements and principles of design in housing and
commercial and residential interiors.

AC02F472B4D5456B955C0014656C06CF.description:
Evaluate housing and design concepts and theories, including
sustainability and universal design, in relation to available resources and
options.

4C61D52E2C274876866E30B099C611FB.description:
Demonstrate professional skill for a variety of cooking methods including
roasting, broiling, smoking, grilling, sautéing, pan frying, deep frying,
braising, stewing, poaching, steaming and baking using professional
equipment and current technologies.

8E0AFE2156554CC49D015A48C8E127B2.description:
Demonstrate professional skills in safe handling of knives, tools and
equipment.

106ED4357FBF44DAA6154DD059E24B3B.description:
Demonstrate professional food preparation methods and techniques for
all menu categories to produce a variety of food products that meet
customer needs.

1C89380227D646188839058265A689E5.description: Analyze current types of cleaning and sanitizing materials for proper use.

FE322DBC15E044099B406F1373574422.description: Practice standard personal hygiene and wellness procedures.

08CBDBBAE00E4DAFA7B698A907AF56F6.description: Demonstrate food safety and sanitation procedures.

61685D7F63024CF0912DA095F942E5CD.description:
Integrate knowledge, skills and practices required for careers in food
production and services.

682415B36A334A1C95621159F25E41AF.description:
Summarize the importance of friends, family and community
relationships for individuals with a variety of conditions that affect their
well-being.

8A52126C391A4AD79F39FA6CAE32C7FF.description:
Differentiate between situations that require personal prevention or
intervention and those situations that require professional assistance.

A9C094DE063748AF88FEC4ED941E9DA5.description:
Investigate health, wellness and safety issues of individuals and families
with a variety of conditions that could influence their well-being.

F6FBFA1C30AE4D8A8CC19CC77611BCD1.description:
Analyze the impact of conditions that could influence the well-being of
individuals and families.

76E36084D5EB45909D824F563A6A2AA5.description:
Analyze the effects of social and cultural diversity on individuals and
families.

2831554FFDE74464B8DDC0B729F4AFAA.description:
Demonstrate awareness of multiple diversities and their effects on
individuals, families and society.

F53013360F2C4C41A902FF6216C7EE58.description:
Evaluate the effects of diverse perspectives, needs and characteristics of
individual families.

D7B8C03090B14EB5925B34A26B360F79.description: Analyze the role of family in transmitting societal expectations.

BDD078EF8BB048A7B83CA5485FB9A9EE.description: Analyze family as the basic unit of society.

9DAB9AD0E2E34B5EBFAD9C85C19F426C.description: Analyze the effects of family as a system on individuals and society.

59400768427C4567AF82EB1D07DCAE66.description:
Evaluate the significance of family and its effects on the well-being of
individuals and society.

E7F63B4232484AD1A08799496823C88E.description:
Apply financial management principles to individual and family financial
practices.

9E3E92EE7B5E47F0B2435E8C0B646241.description: Evaluate the need for personal and family financial planning.

0F6696F18BEC45249A19ACE55AE42650.description:
Demonstrate management of financial resources to meet the goals of
individuals and families across the lifespan.

38AD819F2D4A46179D653305BC7BB747.description:
Analyze how individuals and families make choices to satisfy needs and
wants.

226E0686478E4D0384D74AEDF6FB4C72.description:
Apply time management, organizational and process skills to prioritize
tasks and achieve goals.

7555BA3ACD65454AB1F8C6C03FC7741A.description:
Demonstrate management of individual and family resources such as
food, clothing, shelter, health care, recreation, transportation, time and
human capital.

DB4BC30DC2424353A948E27FE448EA16.description:
Evaluate management practices related to the human, economic and
environmental resources in a global context.

DAC2A659FBF14322AB4C292FBC195486.description:
Develop a life plan, including pathways to acquiring the knowledge and
skills needed to achieve individual, family and career goals.

93E9B9CDC47247D2977FE62D5B775EF5.description:
Analyze potential effects of various career path decisions on balancing
work and family.

9F183D038C4145FFAD4853DCC8919046.description:
Analyze strategies to manage multiple roles and responsibilities
(individual, family, career, community and global).

E7858ACA42D04218BBA2AF832E738C01.description:
Integrate multiple life roles and responsibilities in family, work and
community settings.

0B4181BBBEC642B3877D5275403D3946.description: Family and Consumer Sciences Service Area Standards

621A81FFE7924E9DAF23050F530AC1B3.description:
Explore how Iowa’s career and
technical student organizations
(CTSOs) are integral components of
career and technical education courses
through compounding leadership
experiences and professional skill
development, service learning
opportunities in the school and
community and experiential work- and
project-based learning and competitive
events.

50C531F532F140C99BEDEA601B81DC5C.description:
Demonstrate leadership skills and
abilities in school and community
settings through participation in civic
and community leadership and
teamwork opportunities. Exhibit traits
such as compassion, service, listening,
coaching, developing others, team
development, and understanding and
appreciating others.

D23D0984E7D549A291343D01E8C9E915.description: Leadership & Career and Technical Student Organizations (CTSOs)

7418CB0952C34E56BC34F7DA517ED1EF.description:
Examine how the industry contributes to
or influences society.

C3CB5F0E1A804848AEF26140AF351121.description:
Model ethical behavior and sound
decision-making principles in the
learning environment.

B4E324DEAF654B2F98763FB1EE1494B5.description:
Students apply safety practices in the
learning environment.

506714C3D7A648449642D3A9DF653E97.description:
Demonstrate safety and sanitation
procedures for a clean and safe
environment.

5655EE832CF245BCA80104EE3C7AEDC4.description:
Summarize career pathways within
industries; including education needed,
training requirements, knowledge, skills,
attitudes, and available opportunities.

86A794B831504FB7991EC3495946E972.description:
Demonstrate effective responses to
bullying harassment.

E68F4BFE61154C549FCAECC5905C6023.description:
Apply the roles of decision making and
problem solving in reducing and
managing conflict.

BADC741098FA436A84856D0FF23BDCE8.description:
Create an environment that encourages
and respects the ideas,
perspectives, and contributions of all
group members.

65DD1B21EB2143B3B6800F5ADFEDFE1A.description:
Demonstrate transferable knowledge
and skills like attitudes, teamwork,
leadership in the learning environment.
